list_definition.definition: to confirm the truth or correctness of (something)

list_ex_of_english: X-ray radiography of the implosion was used to verifying that the system behaves in general as designed.
Her sample of progressive constructions seems to verify this hypothesis for the eighteenth century.
In the present work we wanted to verify whether oocytes recovered from preantral follicles were able to acquire calcium activity during follicle culture.
One is to verify whether the number of co-occurrences of different species differs from what would be expected by chance alone.
In the case of timber, world and domestic prices are holding steady, or declining, while logging costs are rising as verified by field interviews.
If this is confirmed after the impact equations are solved, the assumption is verified.
This fact must be verified for the safety of the programs.
Figure 12 displays the local mobility distribution within workspace, where we can verify the mobility of more than 100 within workspace.
